verses.verse: The words <WH1697> of the Preacher <WH6953>, the son <WH1121> of David <WH1732>, king <WH4428> in Yerushalayim <WH3389>.
Vanity <WH1892> of vanities <WH1892>, saith <WH559> <WH8804> the Preacher <WH6953>, vanity <WH1892> of vanities <WH1892>; all is vanity <WH1892>.
What profit <WH3504> hath a man <WH120> of all his labour <WH5999> which he taketh <WH5998> <WH8799> under the sun <WH8121> ?

One generation <WH1755> passeht away <WH1980> <WH8802>, and another generation <WH1755> cometh <WH935> <WH8802> <WH8676> <WH935> <WH8804>: but the earth <WH776> abideth <WH5975> <WH8802> for ever <WH5769>.
The sun <WH8121> also ariseht <WH2224> <WH8804>, and the sun <WH8121> goeth down <WH935> <WH8804>, and hasteth <WH7602> <WH8802> to his place <WH4725> where he arose <WH2224> <WH8802>.

The wind <WH7307> goeth <WH1980> <WH8802> toward the south <WH1864>, and turneth about <WH5437> <WH8802> unto the north <WH6828>; it whirleth about continually <WH1980> <WH8802>, and the wind <WH7307> returneth again <WH7725> <WH8804> according to his circuits <WH5439>.

All the rivers <WH5158> run <WH1980> <WH8802> into the sea <WH3220>; yet the sea <WH3220> is not full <WH4392>; unto the place <WH4725> from whence the rivers <WH5158> come <WH1980> <WH8802>, thither they return <WH7725> <WH8802> again <WH3212> <WH8800>.

All things <WH1697> are full of labour <WH3023>; man <WH376> cannot <WH3201> <WH8799> utter <WH1696> <WH8763> it: the eye <WH5869> is not satisfied <WH7646> <WH8799> with seeing <WH7200> <WH8800>, nor the ear <WH241> filled <WH4390> <WH8735> with hearing <WH8085> <WH8800>.
The thing that hath been, it is that which shall be; and that which is done <WH6213> <WH8738> is that which shall be done <WH6213> <WH8735>: and there is no new <WH2319> thing under the sun <WH8121>.

Is there <WH3426> any thing <WH1697> whereof it may be said <WH559> <WH8799>, See <WH7200> <WH8798>, this is new <WH2319>? it hath been already <WH3528> of old time <WH5769>, which was before <WH6440> us.
There is no remembrance <WH2146> of former <WH7223> things; neither shall there be any remembrance <WH2146> of things that are to come <WH314> with those that shall come after <WH314>.
I the Preacher <WH6953> was king <WH4428> over Yisra'EL <WH3478> in Yerushalayim <WH3389>.

And I gave <WH5414> <WH8804> my heart <WH3820> to seek <WH1875> <WH8800> and search out <WH8446> <WH8800> by wisdom <WH2451> concerning all things that are done <WH6213> <WH8738> under heaven <WH8064>: this sore <WH7451> travail <WH6045> hath 'Elohim <WH430> given <WH5414> <WH8804> to the sons <WH1121> of man <WH120> to be exercised <WH6031> <WH8800> therewith.
I have seen <WH7200> <WH8804> all the works <WH4639> that are done <WH6213> <WH8738> under the sun <WH8121>; and, behold, all is vanity <WH1892> and vexation <WH7469> of spirit <WH7307>.
That which is crooked <WH5791> <WH8794> cannot <WH3201> <WH8799> be made straight <WH8626> <WH8800>: and that which is wanting <WH2642> cannot <WH3201> <WH8799> be numbered <WH4487> <WH8736>.

I communed <WH1696> <WH8765> with mine own heart <WH3820>, saying <WH559> <WH8800>, Lo, I am come to great estate <WH1431> <WH8689>, and have gotten <WH3254> <WH8689> more wisdom <WH2451> than all they that have been before <WH6440> me in Yerushalayim <WH3389>: yea, my heart <WH3820> had great <WH7235> <WH8687> experience <WH7200> <WH8804> of wisdom <WH2451> and knowledge <WH1847>.

And I gave <WH5414> <WH8799> my heart <WH3820> to know <WH3045> <WH8800> wisdom <WH2451>, and to know <WH3045> <WH8800> madness <WH1947> and folly <WH5531>: I perceived <WH3045> <WH8804> that this <WH1571> also is vexation <WH7475> of spirit <WH7307>.
For in much <WH7230> wisdom <WH2451> is much <WH7230> grief <WH3708>: and he that increaseht <WH3254> <WH8686> knowledge <WH1847> increaseht <WH3254> <WH8686> sorrow <WH4341>.
